description: Ensure trash/debris (U) is removed from floors.
Tile floors must be dusted, swept, and mopped (D).
Carpet must be vacuumed (U).
Sinks will be clean, free of dust (D) and debris (U), and dry (W).
Display drain plug in the up position (I).
(Optional) Rubber stoppers will be grounded (G) to the right side (I) of the faucet.
(Optional) Drinking cups/glasses must be clean (D) and serviceable (N). Grounded to the left (Pos 1&2) or right (Pos 3&4) and to the back wall.
(Optional) Hand Soap: Only 1 hand soap per sink will be grounded (G) to the left side (I) of the faucet.
Soap Tray and Toothbrush Holder chrome will be clean (D), free of dust (D) and debris (U), and dry (W). No items authorized on top.
The sink cabinet must be neatly arranged. Doors will be closed when not in use (I).
The cabinet, authorized items, and optional storage bins will be clean (D), free of dust (D) and debris (U), and dry (W).
Hangers will stand upright and be grounded to the left and/or right side of either corner.
Items will be sized tallest to shortest from left to right (S), with no break at the center point of the cabinet.
Items in cabinet will be clean (D/U).
Mirrors will be clean, free of dust and debris, and clear of smudges (D/U).
Items will stand upright unless the container or shape does not allow (I).
Items will be sized tallest to shortest from left to right (S).
The entire surface and bowl will be cleaned (D/U).
Toilet seat and lid must be in the up position (I).
(Optional) Rack behind toilet may have up to two extra rolls of toilet paper. OTs may have an additional wastebasket long side grounded to the wall and short side flushed with the doorframe.
(Optional) You may have a wastebasket long side grounded to the wall and short side flushed with the doorframe.
The shower will be clean and free of soap scum (D), mold, dirt, hair (U), etc.
The shower door will be left open (I).
(Optional) Squeegee may be displayed inside the shower, grounded to corner of shower floor (G), nearest the hinge side of the shower door.

(Optional) A bathmat or towel may be in the shower, as long as it is grounded to the base of the shower and centered (G). If a towel is used, it must be draped over the shower door neatly when not in use.

(Optional) Wet Uniform Items (PTG): Jacket/Pants will be hung on a hanger on the shower frame. Shoes will be placed inside the shower. Gloves on rack above toilet. Underwear/socks stowed in laundry bag.
Towels will not be stained or heavily soiled (D) and must be serviceable (N). Towels may be wet but must not drip.
Fold towel in half lengthwise (F). Drape the towel evenly (I) over the towel rack. Ground the single folds to the brackets (G).
Hand towel must be serviceable (D/N/U) and may be damp but not soaking wet. Fold and display same as large towel.
The wastebasket will always be lined with a trash bag (A).
Trash bag must be empty and free of debris (U). No trash, dust, or debris under the liner.
Display the wastebasket on the wall nearest Occupant 1's desk, grounding (G) the long side of the wastebasket to the wall (I).
Iron cord will be neatly wrapped (I). Iron and ironing board will be dust free (D/U) and neatly displayed in closet.
Windows, blinds, and drapes will be down and closed to conserve energy (I).
All blinds, curtains, and ledges will be free of debris and dusted daily (D/U).
Will be clean and free of debris (U), spots, and streaks (D).
Will be clean and dust free (D/U) and in serviceable working condition (N).
Center the lamp on the dressers between the two beds (H). Lamp shade will be grounded to the wall (G).
All items used to make the bed must be clean, dry, and serviceable.
Bed rails must be clean and dust free.
Fitted or bottom sheet placed neatly over mattress ensuring it is tight, neat and wrinkle free.
Make hospital corners on the inspection side, tucking excess on the non-inspection side if unable to make corners on the non-inspection side.
Ensure the comforter and sheet are tight, neat, and wrinkle free.
(Optional) When displayed on top of the comforter, tan blanket will be neatly folded three times, centered on and flush with the foot end of the mattress.
(Optional) Display neatly folded three times, centered on and flush with the foot end of the mattress or tan blanket. Stack blankets with largest on the bottom.
Ensure pillowcase is right side out, fold excess underneath the pillow.
Ensure the pillow is flush with the head end of the mattress and centered on the width.
Center the mattress on the bed frame and ground it to the foot end of bed frame.
Properly size all items on shelves from tallest to shortest, left to right.
Ensure trash/debris is removed from floors. Floors must be vacuumed.
(Optional) Dry Towel: Drape towel evenly over top bed rail. Ground single fold to inspection side of bed.
(Optional) Hand Towel/Wash Cloth: Drape evenly over the dry towel or bed rail. Ground single fold to inspection side of bed.
Ensure chairs are free of dust and debris.
The chair will be pushed in and grounded to the side closest to the entry door and front of desk when not in use.
The hydration system or backpack will be draped over the back of the chair. Zippers and hook and loop will be closed.
All desk surfaces and interiors must be dry, clean, and free of dust and debris.
(Optional) Displayed grounded to the back corner and side closest to the room entry. Must be password protected and open at a 90° angle.
(Optional) Printer will be free of dust and debris. Display on the opposite side of the computer, grounded to the back, desk corner.
(Optional) Items will not be left on the glass and paper will not be in the tray.
(Optional) One picture frame (max 8x10) may be stored on the top shelf, centered, and flush with the front edge.
(Optional) Only one plastic bin/bag for small office supplies is authorized; must be neatly stored and grounded to the front left corner.
(Optional) Printer paper will be grounded to the front right corner.
All drawer items and interiors must be dry, clean, and free of dust and debris.
All items will be serviceable (i.e., no rips or tears).
Neatly fold PT shorts, T-shirts, and optional form fitting shorts. Ground the bottom item to the front right corner of the drawer.
Running socks will be rolled or folded neatly. Place sock grounded to the front left corner of the drawer.
Roll socks as a pair, ensuring upward curve faces the front of the drawer.
(Optional) If displaying long johns (cold weather undergarments), fold neatly and ground to back right corner. Stack items with the longest item on the bottom in the pyramid effect.
Roll shirts per folding instructions. Place the hemmed edge down at the 6 o'clock position and open end facing the rear of the drawer.
Neatly fold underwear/boxers. Ground the bottom item to the front right corner of the drawer. Stack with largest on the bottom. They must be each grounded to the front right corner of the drawer.
Any items stored in the security drawer must present a neat and orderly appearance.
The drawer must be locked when the owning Officer Trainee is not in the room.
Place the properly filled out AETC Form 341 on top of the dresser, centered and flush with the front edge.
Items will be clean, dry, free of dust and debris, serviceable and shined (if applicable).
Empty all pockets and remove loose strings and all tags that are not sewn in.
Display items as worn (i.e., secure all zippers, hook and loop, and buttons).
OCP Patrol Cap: Display on left side of closet shelf space, as worn. Ensure the bill of the cap is flush with the front edge of the shelf.
Flight Cap: Display to the right of OCP Patrol Cap, triangle facing down. Ensure the front of the cap is flush with the edge of the shelf. Direct commissioned officers wear rank.
(Optional) Watch Cap: Fold in half from left to right. Edges flush and even. Open end is flush to the edge of the shelf.
Ground the thumb side to the right wall/dividing line. Ensure the open ends are flush with each other. See picture in SOP for reference.
Flashlight: Display to the left of gloves. Ensure the flashlight is grounded to the wall or center partition. The lightbulb end will be flush with the front edge of the shelf.
Hang each item with the open end of the hanger toward the rear wall of the closet and left sleeve facing the closet door.
Service dress items will be pressed, neat, and wrinkle-free.
Hangers will be evenly spaced from left to right.

Display items in the correct hanger order (From Left to Right): 1. All-Weather Coat/Liner 2. Lightweight Blue Jacket/Liner 3. Cardigan/Pullover Sweater 4. Service Coat 5. Long Sleeve Blue Shirts/Blouses 6. Short Sleeve Blue Shirts/Blouses 7. Blue Trousers/Slacks 8. Blues Skirt 9. Extreme Cold/Wet Weather (e.g. ECWW Jacket, MASSIF, Gortex) 10. Fleece 11. (Optional) Waffle top/bottom 12. OCP Coat (Tops/Blouses) 13. OCP Trousers 14. PTG Jacket/pants 15. PT Sweater.

General Instructions: Hang items with hanger's open end to the rear. Left sleeve faces door. Press service dress items. Outer garments use 2 wire or 1 plastic hanger. Note for Direct Commissioned Officers: Display rank on all Class A/B outer garments (Service Coat, AWC, LW Jacket, Cardigan).
Hangers: Space hangers evenly. Ground end hangers to brackets or dividing line. Only display an empty hanger for a worn Service Coat, Lightweight Blues Jacket, or All-Weather Coat.

All-Weather Coat/Liner: Do not zip liner to coat. Button all buttons except top. Buckle belt through all loops. Direct commissioned Officers: Display rank. If coat is worn, display liner alone as if inside.
Lightweight Blue Jacket/Liner: Zip jacket fully and tuck zipper. Attach liner with tabs. Direct commissioned Officers: Display rank. If jacket is worn, display liner alone as if attached.
Cardigan/Pullover Sweater: Button epaulets. Commissioned Officers: Display rank.
Service Coat: Pin all proper accoutrements with exception to rank. Hang on 1 plastic hanger. If coat is worn, leave empty hanger evenly spaced. Direct commissioned officers wear rank.
Long Sleeve Blue Shirt/Blouse: Button all buttons. Group all similar shirts/blouses together.
Short Sleeve Blue Shirt/Blouse: Button all buttons except the top one. Group all similar shirts/blouses together.
Blue Trousers/Slacks: Button all buttons, zip fly, and fasten clasp. Drape over hanger bar with legs inseam-to-inseem and cuffs/waistband even. Fly faces closet door.
Blues Skirt: Button all buttons and zip fly. Hang on a separate hanger, attached with pins. Skirt front faces left.
ECWW Jacket: Zip fully. Roll and secure hood. Snap any pockets. Hang on one hanger. Tuck zipper string out of sight.
Fleece: Zip fully to the top. Hang on one hanger and ensure pockets are empty.
Waffle top/bottom (Optional): Hang on one hanger, displayed in the same manner as PTG jacket and pants.
OCP Coat/Top: Hang each on a separate hanger. Display as worn: all buttons fastened, including wrists. Group all OCP coats together.
OCP Trousers: Button all buttons. Hang each pair on a separate hanger, draped over bar with legs inseam-to-inseem and cuffs/waistband even. Group all OCP trousers together.
PTG Jacket/Pants: On a single hanger: Jacket (pockets empty, front zipper unzipped, pocket zippers zipped) placed over folded pants (cuff zippers zipped). Hang with fly facing the door.
PT Sweater: Hang on one hanger, to the right of the PTG items. The small front emblem must face the PTG.
(Optional) Waffle top/bottom: Hang on one hanger, display in the same manner as the PTG jacket and pants.
Pull the laundry bag strings tight so the top of the bag is closed. Excess string will be tucked towards the back neatly.
Ensure the laundry bag is grounded to the corner of the back wall, opposite the shoe display.
Shoes will be neat, clean/dust free and dry. All items need to be serviceable.
Ground the heels and soles of each pair together. Ground the sole of the first shoe to the wall of the doorway.
Tightly lace your shoes and boots by pulling the laces as tight as possible, leaving untied, and tuck the excess laces inside the shoe or boot, out of sight.
Display shoes in the correct order: 1. Combat Boots 2. Low Quarters 3. (Optional) Pumps 4. Running Shoes 5. Shower Shoes.
